title: Nuclear power plants : permanent shutdowns 2005 to 2019
summary: Overall Number of shutdowns has decreased over the Year.

Number of shutdowns is roughly constant from 2006 to 2010, gradually increasing from 2010 to 2011, roughly constant from 2011 to 2014, slightly increasing from 2014 to 2015, and lastly roughly constant from 2015 to 2019.

The line significantly remained stable by 7.0 from Year 2006 to 2007,remained stable by 1.0 from Year 2007 to 2008,increased by 12.0 from Year 2010 to 2011,remained stable by 10.0 from Year 2011 to 2012,remained stable by 3.0 from Year 2012 to 2013,remained stable by 5.0 from Year 2013 to 2014, and lastly, increased by 6.0 from Year 2014 to 2015.
The most drastic increase took place within the Year 2010 and 2011.
The highest Number of shutdowns, of value 13.0 was reached at Year 2011
Minimum Number of shutdowns about 1.0 was reached at Year 2007,  2010, and 2014

The line rapidly remained stable by 87.5% from Year 2006 to 2007,remained stable by 100.0% from Year 2007 to 2008,increased by 1200.0% from Year 2010 to 2011,remained stable by 76.92% from Year 2011 to 2012,remained stable by 100.0% from Year 2012 to 2013,remained stable by 83.33% from Year 2013 to 2014, and lastly, increased by 600.0% from Year 2014 to 2015.
